result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Lewis Weatherspoon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, court costs and victim witness surcharges.  To be paid by 5/15/17.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for AODA treatment.

Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin Lewis Weatherspoon in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Justin Lewis Weatherspoon in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 58 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for AODA treatment.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 5/15/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 5/15/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Justin Lewis Weatherspoon in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Justin Lewis Weatherspoon in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Justin Lewis Weatherspoon not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin Lewis Weatherspoon in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Justin Lewis Weatherspoon in custody.  Ron Dague for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin Lewis Weatherspoon in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Justin Lewis Weatherspoon in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case recalled to set new preliminary hearing date due to drug case and must be set within 10 days. April 9, 2015 at 1:30 preliminary hearing rescheduled.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

The court advised this is a praxis bail recommendation. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Justin Lewis Weatherspoon in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Justin Lewis Weatherspoon in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
